title: JetBlue announces two new transatlantic destinations from Boston in 2026
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Flights The seasonal flights launch in April and May.
A JetBlue plane taking off from Logan International Airport in March.

title: South Station fare gates are scheduled to go live in December. Here’s what to know.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Transportation The fare gates have been in use at North Station since 2022.
MBTA Commuter rail passengers going through the electronic fare gates at North Station in 2023.
Jonathan Wiggs/The Boston Globe Three years after North Station, South Station is set to get fare gates in December.

title: Seaport biotech lays off most of its employees amid sale talks
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business Sensei Biotherapeutics is reducing its workforce by 65% as it evaluates strategic options in a weak fundraising environment.
A view of the Seaport area on September 24, 2025 that show the Childrens Museum, Moakley Federal Courthouse, Boston Tea Party Museum.

(David L Ryan/ Boston Globe Staff) Sensei Biotherapeutics, a cancer-focused biotech with offices in the Seaport, announced this week it will shed about 65% of its staff while evaluating a potential sale.

title: Reflections from Vince Wilfork, Isaiah Thomas and the rest of 2025 ‘Tradition’ honorees
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "It feels like I won multiple championships and I was only here for two-and-a-half, three years.
" Isaiah Thomas has remained a fan favorite whenever he returns to Boston.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa, File) By Conor Ryan November 19, 2025 | 12:31 PM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Jaylen Brown, Joe Mazzulla explain Brown’s first-half benching
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "The team kind of feeds off me, I know that, so I gotta be better.
Joe [Mazzulla] is just holding me to a higher standard.

" Joe Mazzulla talking to Jaylen Brown during preseason on October 15 (Charles Krupa/AP) The Celtics improved to 8-7 after a 113-99 victory over the Brooklyn Nets Tuesday night, the first time they’ve been above .

title: A Vermont mountain breaks a snow record, a NH one says its close
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Skiing One resort is opening a week early due to abundant snow, calling this month "a November to Remember.
" Mount Mansfield Peak in Stowe, Vermont in 2017.
File By Kristi Palma November 19, 2025 | 11:46 AM 1 minute to read New England ski mountains are rejoicing over recent snow and some are even breaking records.

title: ‘Situationships,’ explained
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters Many people view noncommittal relationships as undesirable.
This week's Love Letters podcast guest offers a different perspective.
A couple strolls along Spectacle Island with the sun setting behind downtown Boston in the distance.

title: ‘We are returning to the World Cup’: Scotland, Curaçao qualifications offered a dramatic 2026 preview
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update Curaçao became the smallest nation to ever qualify for a World Cup.
Scotland's Scott McTominay scores a bicycle kick goal as his nation eventually defeated Denmark to qualify for the 2026 World Cup.

Andrew Milligan/PA via AP By Hayden Bird November 19, 2025 | 11:39 AM 3 minutes to read The World Cup’s field of 48 is almost full: The FIFA World Cup arrives in North America in 2026, with Gillette Stadium set to host seven matches.

title: Boston man charged with selling ‘ghost guns,’ machine gun possession
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Joshua Morency, 28, of Dorchester, allegedly sold 21 firearms to a law enforcement informant at a Stop & Shop parking lot and a Shell station, among other sites.
A Sig Sauer 9 mm semi-automatic pistol like this one was among the firearms allegedly sold to a confidential ATF informant.
Washington Post photo by Sarah L.
